i1.name: Darkness_Rise
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Mordekaiser's''' basic attacks deal {{as|40% AP}} {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}} {{tip|on-hit}}.

'''Morderkaiser''' generates a [[stack]] for each enemy {{tip|champion}} or {{tip|monster}} hit by his [[basic attack]]s and basic [[champion ability|abilities]], which lasts 4 seconds, refreshing on subsequent hits and stacking up to 3 times. At 3 stacks, '''Mordekaiser''' gains ''Darkness Rise''.

{{sbc|Darkness Rise:}} '''Mordekaiser''' gains {{sti|ms|{{as|{{pp|3 to 9 for|1;6;11|key=%}} '''bonus''' movement speed}}}} and creates an [[aura]] that deals{{ft|{{as|{{pp|5 to 15.2}}|magic damage}} {{as|(+ 30% AP)}} {{as|(+ {{pp|key=%|1 to 5}} of target's '''maximum''' health)}} {{as|magic damage}} per second|{{as|{{pp|5*0.125 to 15.2*0.125}}|magic damage}} {{as|(+ {{ap|30*0.125}}% AP)}} {{as|(+ {{pp|key=%|1*0.125 to 5*0.125}} of target's '''maximum''' health)}} {{as|magic damage}} every {{fd|0.125}} seconds}}to nearby enemies. The damage per second against monsters is capped at 180.
i1.descriptionHtml:
Innate: Mordekaiser's basic attacks deal 40% AP bonus magic damage on-hit.
Morderkaiser generates a stack for each enemy champion or monster hit by his basic attacks and basic champion ability, which lasts 4 seconds, refreshing on subsequent hits and stacking up to 3 times. At 3 stacks, Mordekaiser gains Darkness Rise.
Darkness Rise: Mordekaiser gains 1;6;11 ‒ undefined bonus movement speed and creates an aura that dealsto nearby enemies. The damage per second against monsters is capped at 180.
i1.notes:
* '''Mordekaiser''' has a stack counter under his health-bar that is not visible to other champions.
* ''Darkness Rise's'' damage doesn't refresh ''Darkness Rise's'' buff.

q1.name: Obliterate
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Mordekaiser''' smashes the area in the target direction, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to enemies within, {{ccs|increased|magic}} if it hits only one enemy.
q1.descriptionHtml: Active: Mordekaiser smashes the area in the target direction, dealing magic damage to enemies within, Unknown value: ccs / increased / magic if it hits only one enemy.
leveling:
{{st|Magic Damage|{{pp|5+4*(x-1) for 10; then + 10*x for 5; then +16*x}} (+ {{ap|75 to 155}}) {{as|(+ 60% AP)}}}}
{{st|Damage Increase|{{ap|40 to 60}}%}}
q1.notes:
* Applies {{tip|spell damage}} if it hits one target and {{tip|area damage}} to multiple targets.
{{Effect at cast time end}}

  • Damage Increase: %

w1.name: Indestructible
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Mordekaiser''' stores 45% of the {{tt|post-mitigation|Damage calculated after modifiers}} damage he deals and 15% of the {{tt|pre-mitigation|Damage calculated before modifiers}} damage he takes,{{ft|reduced by 75% for non-champion sources,|reduced to {{fd|11.25}}% of damage dealt and {{fd|3.75}}% of damage taken for non-champion sources,}}as ''Potential Shield'' on his secondary resource bar, up to {{sti|health|{{as|30% of his '''maximum''' health}}}}. The ''Potential Shield'' decays by {{pp|8 to 25}} every second after not dealing or taking damage for 1 second. While ''Indestructible'' is not on cooldown, the ''Potential Shield'' will not decay below a minimum of {{as|5% of his '''maximum''' health}}, and it will be set to that amount when it comes off cooldown if it was previously below it.

{{sbc|Active:}} '''Mordekaiser''' consumes his ''Potential Shield'' to {{tip|shield}} himself for 4 seconds for the same amount. The shield decays exponentially over the duration. ''Indestructible'' can be recast after {{fd|0.5}} seconds while the shield is active.
{{sbc|Recast:}} '''Mordekaiser''' consumes the remaining shield, {{tip|healing}} for a portion of the amount.
w1.descriptionHtml:
Passive: Mordekaiser stores 45% of the post-mitigation damage he deals and 15% of the pre-mitigation damage he takes,as Potential Shield on his secondary resource bar, up to 30% of his maximum health. The Potential Shield decays by 8 − 25 (based on level) every second after not dealing or taking damage for 1 second. While Indestructible is not on cooldown, the Potential Shield will not decay below a minimum of 5% of his maximum health, and it will be set to that amount when it comes off cooldown if it was previously below it.
Active: Mordekaiser consumes his Potential Shield to shield himself for 4 seconds for the same amount. The shield decays exponentially over the duration. Indestructible can be recast after 0.5 seconds while the shield is active.
Recast: Mordekaiser consumes the remaining shield, healing for a portion of the amount.
w1.notes: *Both casts count as ability activations for the purposes of on-cast effects such as {{tip|Spellblade}} and stacking {{ai|Force Pulse|Kassadin}}.

e1.name: Death's_Grasp
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Mordekaiser''' summons a claw in the target direction that grants {{tip|sight}} of the area. After {{fd|0.5}} seconds, it deals {{as|magic damage}} to enemies within and {{tip|airborne|pulls}} them 250 units.
e1.descriptionHtml:
Passive: Mordekaiser gains magic penetration.
Active: Mordekaiser summons a claw in the target direction that grants sight of the area. After 0.5 seconds, it deals magic damage to enemies within and pulls them 250 units.
e1.notes:
* ''Death's Grasp'' will still {{tip|airborne|pull}} even if '''Mordekaiser''' {{tip|death|dies}}.
{{Effect at cast time start}}

r1.name: Realm_of_Death
description:
{{sbc|Active:}} '''Mordekaiser''' {{tip|slow|slows}} the target enemy champion by 75% during the cast time, then {{tip|suppression|icononly=true}} {{tt|banishes|Does not disable the target's actions}} them with him to the ''Death Realm'' for 7 seconds.

'''Mordekaiser''' also consumes the target's soul for 7 seconds, {{tip|heal|healing}} himself for {{as|10% of their '''maximum''' health}} and reducing their '''current''' {{sti|{{as|attack damage}}}}, {{sti|{{as|ability power}}}}, {{sti|{{as|'''total''' attack speed}}}}, {{ccs|{{sti|{{as|'''maximum''' health}}}}|true}}, {{sti|armor|{{as|armor}}}}, {{sti|magic resistance|{{as|magic resist}}}}, and [[size]] by 10%, in addition to gaining them for himself. If the target dies while inside the ''Death Realm'', '''Mordekaiser''' keeps their partial stats until they [[death|respawn]].

Units between realms see each other as spirits, considering each other dead and negating any interactions between each other. Only '''Mordekaiser''' and the target will enter the realm; other champions cannot follow them. Everything that occurs inside the ''Death Realm'' is hidden to units outside of it, and all {{tip|pet|pets}} still inside are killed at the end.
If one of the two affected champions leave the ''Death Realm'', because of having died or having it dispelled, the other will do so as well.
r1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Mordekaiser slows the target enemy champion by 75% during the cast time, then suppression banishes them with him to the Death Realm for 7 seconds.

Mordekaiser also consumes the target's soul for 7 seconds, healing himself for 10% of their maximum health and reducing their current attack damage, ability power, total attack speed, maximum health / true">Unknown value: ccs / maximum health / true, armor, magic resist, and size by 10%, in addition to gaining them for himself. If the target dies while inside the Death Realm, Mordekaiser keeps their partial stats until they death.
Units between realms see each other as spirits, considering each other dead and negating any interactions between each other. Only Mordekaiser and the target will enter the realm; other champions cannot follow them. Everything that occurs inside the Death Realm is hidden to units outside of it, and all pets still inside are killed at the end.
If one of the two affected champions leave the Death Realm, because of having died or having it dispelled, the other will do so as well.
r1.notes:
[[File:Realm_of_Death_ally_Spirit_screenshot.PNG|thumb|right|125px|'''Ally Spirit''']]
[[File:Realm_of_Death_enemy_spirit_screenshot.PNG|thumb|right|125px|'''Enemy Spirit''']]
* ''Realm of Death'' retains '''Mordekaiser's''' previous '''current''' health percentage when granting him a portion of the target's '''maximum''' health.
* ''Realm of Death'' will cancel and go on cooldown after its cast time if:
** The target is {{tip|displacement immune}}, {{tip|cc-immune|crowd control immune}} or protected by a {{tip|spell shield}}.
** The target is a {{tip|clone}} or {{cai|Glory in Death|Sion}}.
{{Unit-targeted cancel conditions}}
* ''Realm of Death'' can be dispelled if:
** The target uses a {{tip|cleanse|cleansing}} effect, with the exceptions of {{si|Cleanse}}, {{ii|Mikael's Blessing}}, and {{cis|Kled}} {{ai|Skaarl the Cowardly Lizard 2|Kled|Dismount}}.
*** {{ais|Soul Unbound|Yone}} recast is disabled while in the ''Realm of Death'', but will cleanse it if somehow cast.
** '''Mordekaiser''' or the target cast another ''Realm of Death''. The affected champions will remain stuck for the duration of the new circle.
* {{tip|Spell shield}} will not block the initial {{tip|slow}}.
* If the target's {{stil|health}} is lower than the amount that should be stolen, they will be brought down to 1 health. '''Mordekaiser''' will still get the usual amount of maximum health.
* Entering or leaving the ''Death Realm'' will cause all targeted {{tip|projectile|projectiles}} to be {{tip|homing projectile destruction|destroyed}}.
* The transition in and out of the ''Death Realm'' doesn't interrupt {{tip|channel|channels}}.
** {{ai|Grand Starfall|Pantheon}} will always be interrupted from the transition into the realm.
* The boundaries are not considered terrain ({{ai|Unstoppable Onslaught|Sion}} exception), and enemies that try to move out of the area will be displaced back inside.
** {{tip|Dash|Dashes}}, {{tip|blink|blinks}}, {{tip|airborne|displacements}} and other forms of movement will cap their effect range to the boundary. Targets will stop at the boundary even after it expired.
* ''Realm of Death'' will not be dispelled if either of the two affected champions enter {{tip|resurrection}} after taking lethal damage. It is dispelled if the target enters a {{tip|zombie state}}.
* Any active {{tip|tether}} effects (both friendly and hostile ones) existing on either of the two champions entering the realm will be broken (unless the tether is between those two).
* Upon entering the realm, '''Mordekaiser''' and the target are {{tip|cleanse|cleansed}} from all {{tip|forced action}} effects 
** The cleanse will occur even if the source enters the realm.{{bug}}
* Unlike the other stats, '''Mordekaiser''' does not ''steal'' enemy total size; instead he gains 10% of his own size and reduces the enemy's size by 10% of theirs (all size modifiers stack additively).
** '''Mordekaiser''' grows in size over {{fd|0.25}} seconds after successfully stealing his targets' stats, and shrinks over {{fd|0.25}} seconds after the buff runs out again. The target shrinks over {{fd|0.25}} seconds after their stats are stolen, but grows back to normal size instantly when the effect ends.
* ''Realm of Death's'' interactions with other elements/abilities:
** Multiple ''Death Realms'' (possible through a {{ai|Hijack|Sylas|hijacked}} ''Realm of Death'' or if multiple '''Mordekaisers''' are in the same match) spawned will exist in the same dimension, allowing champions to see and interact with champions bound to other circles. Champions are only affected by their boundaries and are not able to see the others.
*** {{cai|Devour|Tahm Kench}} can carry a target outside of their circle, but they will be displaced back inside once {{ai|Regurgitate|Tahm Kench|Regurgitated}}.
*** An active {{ai|Cease and Desist|Vi}} on a target outside the perimeter will cause {{ci|Vi}} to continue her charge until her circle ends. She can knock back and damage secondary targets multiple times.
** [[Structures]] exist in all realms at the same time. {{tip|Turret|Turrets}} will behave normally as if all units were in the same realm.
<!--** The {{tip|Chemtech Fog}} on {{ui|Chemtech Drake|Chemtech Rift}} and the [[Dragon pit (League of Legends)#Elemental Rift|speed currents]] on {{ui|Cloud Drake|Cloud Rift}} are present between realms.-->
** {{tip|Hex-gate|Hex-gates}} on {{ui|Hextech Drake|Hextech Rift}} will not be present between realms.
** {{tip|Brush|Brushes}} will maintain their presence between realms.
** Switching realms detaches all {{tip|attached}} champions on either of the two champions entering the realm.
*** {{cai|Umbral Trespass|Kayn}} will cause him to detach immediately when ''Realm of Death'' ends.
** The allied health, resource, and ultimate indicators (champion portraits located on the screen) will not update between realms as the [[Summoner|players]] have no {{tip|sight|vision}} of them.
** {{cai|The Hextech Ultimatum|Camille}}, catching {{cai|Spinning Axe|Draven}}, {{cai|Timewinder|Ekko}} and {{ai|Parallel Convergence|Ekko}}, {{cai|Null Zone|Malzahar}}, {{cai|Twisted Advance|Maokai}}, {{cai|Pix, Faerie Companion|Lulu|Pix}}, {{cai|Death from Below|Pyke}}, {{cai|Threaded Volley 2|Taliyah|Worked Grounds}}, {{cai|Gravity Field|Viktor}}, {{cai|Satchel Charge|Ziggs}}, and {{ui|Rift Scuttler|Rift Scuttler's}} {{bi|Speed Shrine}} are exceptions and may still take effect between dimensions ''if'' the conditions are valid.
** Effects such as {{ai|Requiem|Karthus}}, {{ai|Absolute Zero|Nunu}}, {{ai|Grand Starfall|Pantheon}} and {{ai|Final Spark|Lux}} will only deal damage to enemies of the dimension they're in at time of cast. Ending the channel or cast time while inside another dimension will not do damage to nearby enemies.
** Any spawned terrain while in the ''Death Realm'' will remain inside until expired. They will not be destroyed.
** {{cai|Shuriken Flip|Akali}} can be recast even if the target is in another realm.
** {{cai|Lamb's Respite|Kindred}} is one of many area of effect abilities that will not take presence between realms.
** {{cai|Void Shift|Malzahar}} dispels from the initial cast's {{tip|slow}}, thus not being able to resist the ''Realm of Death'' with its crowd control immunity.
** {{cai|Paranoia|Nocturne}} only applies {{tip|nearsight}} to enemy champions in the same dimension as him.
** {{cai|Clockwork Windup|Orianna|Ball}} will snap back to her the moment she switches realms.
** The target of {{ai|Devour|Tahm Kench}} will immediately leave {{cis|Tahm Kench}} belly when he enters or leaves the ''Realm of Death''.
** {{cai|Weaver's Wall|Taliyah}} is interrupted both for if she enters or leaves the ''Realm of Death''.
** {{cai|Fear Beyond Death 2|Urgot|Fear Beyond Death}} cannot be recast while the target is in a different dimension than him. If the target is being reeled in however, then the execution at the end of the channel will take place regardless of the dimension either he or the target is in.
*** The fear upon a successful execution will occur in {{cis|Urgot}} realm.
** {{cai|Sovereign's Domination|Viego|Mist Wraiths}} will spawn between realms. {{ai|Harrowed Path|Viego}} will also take presence between realms.
** {{cai|Bladecaller|Xayah}} cannot call {{ai|Clean Cuts|Xayah|Feathers}} between dimensions.
** {{cis|Zed}} [[File:Zed's Shadow.png|20px|border]] [[Zed/LoL|Shadows]] will take presence between realms.
** {{ii|Eye of the Herald}} and {{si|Teleport}} are disabled while in the ''Realm of Death''.
** Controllable [[pets]] and [[decoy]]s can still be commanded between realms.
** [[Jungle plants]] ({{ui|Blast Cone}}, {{ui|Honeyfruit}}, {{ui|Scryer's Bloom}}) will not take presence between realms.
{{ct|cast}}
